solution_line_template: If the price of an additional bear drops by fifty after the first purchase, the price of each additional bear is ${first_bear_price} - ${discount_per_bear} = $<<{first_bear_price}-{discount_per_bear}={additional_bear_price}>>{additional_bear_price}
Since Wally bought {total_bears} bears, he was charged fifty cents less on {total_bears}-1 = <<{total_bears}-1={num_discounted_bears}>>{num_discounted_bears} bears.

The total cost for the {num_discounted_bears} bears is {num_discounted_bears}*${additional_bear_price} = $<<{num_discounted_bears}*{additional_bear_price}={cost_discounted_bears}>>{cost_discounted_bears}
For the {total_bears} bears, Wally paid a total of ${cost_discounted_bears}+${first_bear_price} = $<<{cost_discounted_bears}+{first_bear_price}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
